SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.Utils.JsonParser.SupportClasses

Class CardGoldenSupportClass

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Utils.JsonParser.SupportClasses.CardResourceSupportClass
it.polimi.ingsw.Utils.JsonParser.SupportClasses.CardGoldenSupportClass
public class CardGoldenSupportClass extends CardResourceSupportClass
Class used by the Json parser as a middleman for the creation of CardGolden Objects.
It extends CardResourceSupportClass and mocks all the attributes in CardGolden.
It checks that the inputs provided by the gson deserializer are valid and if so proceeds to create a CardGolden object, otherwise it throws an IllegalArgumentException specifying what is wrong with the inputs provided.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CardGoldenSupportClass()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    protected Map<Artifacts,Integer>
    checkConstraint()
    Method checks if the constraint provided is a valid constraint.
    Method ensures that the constraint meets the following requirements:
    -Constraint can't be empty.
    -Constraint can't be null.
    -Constraint entries can't have negative values.
    -Constraint entries can't have 0 value.
    -Constraint can only require a maximum total of 5 artifact units.
    -Constraint has to require 2 different types of resources and 3 units if card requires artifact.
    -Constraint has to require 2 different types of resources and 4 units if card requires corner.
    -Constraint has to require 1 type of resource and 3 units if card provides 3 points outright.
    -Constraint has to require 1 type of resource and 5 units if card provides 5 points outright.
    If the conditions are broken then throws IllegalArgumentException
    protected int
    checkGoldenPoints()
    Method checks if the provided points do not contradict the definition of a Golden Card:
    -Can't be a negative value.
    -Has to be either 1, 2, 3 or 5.
    If the conditions are broken then throws IllegalArgumentException
    protected Artifacts
    checkRequiredArtifact()
    Method checks if card requires an Artifact as points multiplier.
    If requiredArtifact is not null then method ensures that:
    -Points has to be 1.
    -requiresCorner has to be false
    If the conditions are broken then throws IllegalArgumentException
    protected boolean
    checkRequiresCorner()
    Method checks if card requires corners covered as points multiplier.
    If reuquiresCorner is true then method ensures that:
    -Points has to be 2.
    If the conditions are broken then throws IllegalArgumentException
    Card
    createGoldenCard()
    Creates new CardGolden using the appropriate constructor and giving it as parameters the values returned by the validation methods.

    checkCardColor, checkCorners, checkPoints, createCardResource, getPoints

    • checkGoldenPoints

      protected int checkGoldenPoints()
      Method checks if the provided points do not contradict the definition of a Golden Card:
      -Can't be a negative value.
      -Has to be either 1, 2, 3 or 5.
      If the conditions are broken then throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns:
      Int value with validated points.

    • checkRequiredArtifact

      protected Artifacts checkRequiredArtifact()
      Method checks if card requires an Artifact as points multiplier.
      If requiredArtifact is not null then method ensures that:
      -Points has to be 1.
      -requiresCorner has to be false
      If the conditions are broken then throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns:
      Artifact enum entry required by card.

    • checkRequiresCorner

      protected boolean checkRequiresCorner()
      Method checks if card requires corners covered as points multiplier.
      If reuquiresCorner is true then method ensures that:
      -Points has to be 2.
      If the conditions are broken then throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns:
      boolean value of requiresCorner after checking it is valid.

    • checkConstraint

      protected Map<Artifacts,Integer> checkConstraint()
      Method checks if the constraint provided is a valid constraint.
      Method ensures that the constraint meets the following requirements:
      -Constraint can't be empty.
      -Constraint can't be null.
      -Constraint entries can't have negative values.
      -Constraint entries can't have 0 value.
      -Constraint can only require a maximum total of 5 artifact units.
      -Constraint has to require 2 different types of resources and 3 units if card requires artifact.
      -Constraint has to require 2 different types of resources and 4 units if card requires corner.
      -Constraint has to require 1 type of resource and 3 units if card provides 3 points outright.
      -Constraint has to require 1 type of resource and 5 units if card provides 5 points outright.
      If the conditions are broken then throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns:
      Map containing the constraint after successful validation by the method.

    • createGoldenCard

      public Card createGoldenCard()
      Creates new CardGolden using the appropriate constructor and giving it as parameters the values returned by the validation methods.
      Returns:
      CardGolden object cast to Card created with parsed and validated inputs.
